comments.text:
Created attachment 554095
1.jpg

User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

I have a lot of book marks. If I click the bookmarks menu item the dropdown goes off the bottom of the screen. Once I have selected a bookmark the dropdown does not tidy up the Windows 7 task bar. Win & Ultimate 64bit See 1.jpg attached


Actual results:

I have a lot of book marks. If I click the bookmarks menu item the dropdown goes off the bottom of the screen. Once I have selected a bookmark the dropdown does not tidy up the Windows 7 task bar. Win & Ultimate 64bit See 1.jpg attached


Expected results:

The task bar should have been tidied up. See 1.jpg attached

comments.text:
(In reply to colinsp from comment #2)
> This is for the Classic theme as it is the one I like and have no other
> themes loaded.

I have just tried the Office Black theme and if anything it is worse with this theme as it leaves about 8px across the whole bottom of the page along the top of the task bar corrupted.

comments.creator: netzen@gmail.com
comments.author: netzen@gmail.com
comments.raw_text:
Reproduced.

1. On Windows 7 turn on "Windows 7 Basic" theme from:
   Control Panel -> Appearence and Personalization -> Personalization

2. Once turned on make your bottom bookmark overlap the border of for the bottom bookmark.
   Make one of the favicons overlap the border of the taskbar.

3. You'll notice that on the top border of the taskbar does not repaint.

Google Chrome gets around this by never covering the taskbar. 
IE does cover the taskbar but does not have the problem.

I cannot reproduce this when using Aero.
comments.text:
Reproduced.

1. On Windows 7 turn on "Windows 7 Basic" theme from:
   Control Panel -> Appearence and Personalization -> Personalization

2. Once turned on make your bottom bookmark overlap the border of for the bottom bookmark.
   Make one of the favicons overlap the border of the taskbar.

3. You'll notice that on the top border of the taskbar does not repaint.

Google Chrome gets around this by never covering the taskbar. 
IE does cover the taskbar but does not have the problem.

I cannot reproduce this when using Aero.
